column4: i have unmounted and then tried ot change its system but i get teh same message back
no... but that is what i shall try now
if i refresh ro clsoe and reopen it remounts itself...
sdb
as is it a internal hard drive, or is it a external hard drive
oh... Internal
That is what i am doing.... i currently on a live CD... using GParted
and its still mounting your hard drive? hmm.

when i right click->info at the bottom it says "Warning: Unable to read the contents of this filesystem! Because of this some operations may be unavailable. Did you install the correct plugin for this filesystem?"
what kind of filesystem is on the drive?
There is half of it formated as ntfs with windows on it... and now there is a corrupted almost half of ext3 and then there is a small portion of unallocated
are you right click > info on which one?
whoops i meant which one is giving you that message
the second one, ext3... which i want ot be ext2
so the ext3 one is corrupt? and you dont care about formatting  it?
possibly? i dont care for the ext3 i need a chunk of ext2... but it wont let me have that
ok, so if you dont care for the ext3 one, your just going to format it. So does it not give you the option to change the file system? (cause it is still mounted?)
If i right click i can click on "unmount" and if i do so it unmounts in but then if i click "format to" and "ext2" then click "apply" it gives an error saying its mounted

ok it should list the drive that you are trying to unmount (like /dev/sdwhatever) so, open a terminal, and try once again a "sudo umount /dev/sdwhatever) and then once that is done, go back to gparted, go to "gparted > refresh devices" and try again
Same error
you say that you have multiple partitions on the same drive. Try using that umount command on all partitions on that hard drive, then try again
It worked! :D Thanks... now i shall try to reinstall
